intro: Dugagelia, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. Dugagelia typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to harsh climatic conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of high-altitude flora.
